alert.note: Alert for Boone; Logan; Northwest Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 11:12PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Raleigh, east central Logan, north central Wyoming and southeastern Boone Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1112 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bald Knob, or 15 miles southeast of Madison, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oceana, Wharton, Twin Falls State Park, Bald Knob, Amherstdale-Robinette, Kopperston, Glen Daniel, Naoma, Bolt and Arnett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia.
